intro: Hypoestes chloroclada, commonly known as the "Snowflake" plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright white to pink flowers that resemble snowflakes. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Hypoestes chloroclada is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
